file_content.text: Mimi and the remaining rakghouls are exhibiting heightened violence levels. I almost pity their Republic victims.
I killed the rakghoul leaders and released the pheromones. The pack reacted violently--just as you expected.
I knew it! With my hypothesis validated, our relationship with rakghouls...! I mustn't get ahead of myself. This requires further study.
Your assistance has proven invaluable, my lord. My findings will reflect your influence.
You will forever be a friend of science, agent. I won't forget you when drafting my final report.
Your services have furthered both science and the Empire's cause, hunter. I call that a job well done.
Thanks to you, we've proven rakghouls' use beyond blaster fodder. I'll include your help in my report.
Eliminate the alpha rakghouls, then stir up the nest. My remote sensors will record everything.
Day 43: Mimi continues her antisocial behavior. Rex exhibits Force sensitivity and asserts his dominance over the pack.
Pardon me, my lord. Sometimes I lose my head in my work.
Excuse me, agent. Sometimes my pursuits threaten to consume me.
Please excuse me. If I don't record my observations, they simply float away.
I am Doctor Wylenn, xenobiologist, specializing in rakghoul behavior.
I thought we came here to destroy Taris, not study the local wildlife.
Education isn't our priority.
Sometimes the two pursuits are one and the same.
Any rakghoul breakthroughs?
The last week alone has produced incredible insight.
You really study those freaks?
I'm completely serious. There's more to the creatures than simple bloodlust.
Rakghouls are pack hunters, led by alpha hunters. Socioeconomic status prior to infection has no bearing on their place in the herd.
These alpha hunters are magnificent, fierce warriors. Without them, the pack is lost.
I hope you aren't developing an affinity for those bloodthirsty monsters.
Do I detect awe?
I simply respect their strength, my lord. If handled with caution, we could even use it.
Cut down these alphas, and the monsters will bow to a new master.
They must be made to serve us.
A wise perspective, my lord. With the rakghoul leaders dead, the next step is simple.
Kill the alpha leaders, and the entire pack is ours to manipulate.
We could lead them instead.
Precisely, agent. And once the alphas are dead, the next step is simple.
Don't tell me you're a rak-lover.
They're killers, not pets.
Goodness, no. My job is to discover how to use the rakghouls, and I've done just that.
I'm fiercer than any rakghoul.
Such bravery is precisely why you're fit to apply my research.
How is this useful, doctor?
Exterminate the alpha leaders, and the rakghoul pack is destabilized--and ours to manipulate. The next step is simple.
You see, rakghouls possess incredible olfactory strength. I've engineered an alarm pheromone that peaks their fury.
Simply release these pheromones in the rakghoul warrens, and the frenzied, leaderless beasts will sate their bloodlust on the nearby Republic outpost.
The beasts will soon serve us.
I'll handle the rakghouls.
Science thanks you.
Fine. I'll toy with your raks.
Remember, first assassinate the alpha leaders, then release these pheromones. That's all the encouragement the rakghouls need.
Maybe later. [Refuse quest]
Then I'll continue my research. Mimi still sleeps, but I wonder how many lives Rex will take today.
Fascinating creatures, rakghouls. Simply fascinating.
